OVERVIEW: The Toone series consists of deep, well drained soils that formed in material weathered mainly from diorite and  conglomerate of sandstone and quartzite. These soils are on mountain slopes. The mean annual precipitation is about 27 inches and the mean annual air temperature is about 42 degrees F.

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Clayey-skeletal, smectitic Pachic Palecryolls

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON: Toone loam, rangeland. (Colors are for moist soil unless otherwise noted.)
0l--2 inches to 0 inches; matted leaves and stems.
All--0 to 7 inches; very dark brown (10YR 2/2) heavy loam, very dark brown (10YR 2/2) dry; moderate fine granular structure; soft, friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; many very fine, fine and medium roots; 10 percent gravel; slightly acid (pH 6.2); clear smooth boundary.  (7 to 13 inches thick)
A12--7 to 14 inches; very dark brown (10YR 2/2) heavy loam, very dark brown (10YR 2/2) dry; weak coarse subangular blocky structure that parts to moderate fine granular; soft, friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; many very fine, fine and medium roots; 10 percent gravel; slightly acid (pH 6.2); clear smooth boundary. (7 to 13 inches thick)
A13--14 to 27 inches; very dark brown (10YR 2/2) heavy loam, very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) dry; weak medium and coarse subangular blocky structure that parts to moderate fine granular; soft, friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; common very fine, fine, medium and coarse roots; 15 percent gravel; slightly acid (pH 6.4); gradual irregular boundary. (0 to 14 inches thick)
B21t--27 to 37 inches; dusky red (2.5YR 3/2) very cobbly heavy clay loam, weak red (2.5YR 4/2) dry; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; very hard, firm, sticky and plastic; few very fine and fine roots; few very fine pores; common thin clay skins on faces of peds; 30 percent cobbles and 20 percent pebbles; slightly acid (pH 6.4); clear smooth boundary. (4 to 10 inches thick)
B22t--37 to 60 inches; dusky red (2.5YR 3/2) gravelly clay loam, weak red (2.5YR 4/2) dry; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; extremely hard, firm, sticky and plastic; few very fine and fine roots; few very fine pores; common thin clay skins on faces of peds; 20 percent gravel and 20 percent pebbles; slightly acid (pH 6.4).

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION: Morgan County, Utah; about 2 1/2 miles southwest of Peterson; 200 feet south and 500 feet east of the NW corner of sec. 14, T.14., R.2E.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS: The mollic epipedon is 21 to more than 60 inches thick. The combined thickness of the Al and B2t horizon is more than 60 inches. The upper 20 inches of the B2t horizon is 35 to 45 percent clay. The mean annual soil temperature at depth of 20 inches ranges from 42 to 44 degrees F. The mean summer soil temperature ranges from 57 to 59 degrees F. The soils are usually moist but may be dry for less than 60 consecutive days during the later part of the summer. Rock fragments consist of sandstone and quartzite cobbles and gravel; and range from 10 to 15 percent in the Al horizon and 40 to 50 percent in the B2t horizon.
The Al horizon has hue of 10YR, 7.5YR or 5YR value of 2 through 4 dry, 2 or 3 moist, and chroma of 1 through 3 dry. It ranges from loam in the upper part to loam or light clay loam in the lower part. This horizon is slightly acid or neutral and ranges from 21 to 36 inches thick.
The B2t horizon has hue of 7.5YR, 5YR or 2.5YR, value of 3 or 4 moist, and chroma of 2 through 4 dry and moist. It ranges from very cobbly clay loam to very gravelly light clay. Structure ranges from weak through strong, medium to coarse subangular blocky. Clay films are common to continuous, thin or moderately thick. This horizon is slightly acid or neutral and extends to depth of more than 60 inches.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES: This is the Sligting series.  Sligting soils have A2 horizons.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING: Toone soils are at elevations of 5,800 to 9,800 feet. They occur on short, east-facing mountain slopes. Slopes are 40 to 60 percent. These soils formed in colluvium and residuum weathered from conglomerate of sandstone and quartzite and small amounts of gneiss and schist. The climate is humid and the average annual precipitation ranges from 20 to 30 inches. The mean annual temperature is 35 to 43 degrees F.  The mean summer temperature is 55 to 56 degrees F. and the frost-free period ranges from 30 to 70 days.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: ASSOCIATED SOILS: These are the Hawkins, Ostler and St. Marys soils.  These soils all have mean summer temperature of more than 59 degrees F.  Hawkins soils lack argillic horizons, have less than 20 percent rock fragments in the 10 to 40 inch control section, and crack to the surface in late summer. Ostler soils have mollic epipedons less than 20 inches thick and have less than 20 percent rock fragments in the argillic horizons. St. Marys soils have mollic epipedons less than 20 inches thick, and lack argillic horizons.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY: Well drained; medium runoff; moderately slow permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION: These soils are used for range, wildlife habitat and watershed. The present native vegetation is maple, oakbrush, mountain brome, sweet-anise, wild onion, yarrow, horsemint and bluebells.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT: Northern and central Utah and western Colorado.. The series is inextensive.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Bozeman, Montana

ORIGIN.content:
SERIES ESTABLISHED: Morgan County, Morgan Area, Utah, 1974.
OSED scanned by NSSQA.  Last revised by state 11/74.

(7 to 13 inches thick)

(4 to 10 inches thick)
